NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
1346 CONNECTICUT AVENUE â€¢ WASHINGTON. D. C. 20036
February 12, 1969
Mr. Frank Pace, Jr.
Chairman of the Board
555 Madison Avenue
New York, New York 10022
Dear Frank:
This is to acknowledge with gratitude the receipt of two
checks from the Corporation for Public Broadcasting; one
is a check for $32,500 which represents the first of two
payments on a grant of $65,000 for the Educational Radio
Network; the other is a check for $31,250, which represents
the first of four payments of a grant $125,000 to increase
the program acquisitions of ETS/PS.
We will be happy to work with Don Quayle in his responsibility
for the supervision of these grants and we will supply
a written narrative and financial report at conclusion of
each project.
On behalf of the total Association and especially for the
radio and television station divisions let me express
our appreciation for this timely assistance; be assured
that we will do our utmost to employ this money in such a
way as to make maximum impact from these funds in the
forwarding of public radio and television.
Sincerely yours.
William G. Harley
